required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter Patient Registry on Outcomes From Cryoanalgesia of the Intercostal Nerves
clinical_study.official_title: The CryoICEâ„¢ Cryoanalgesia Registry for Pain Management in Post-cardiothoracic Surgery Via Cryoablation of the Intercostal Nerves

brief_summary.textblock: This is a national retrospective and prospective, multicenter, observational patient registry to record outcomes from patients undergoing cryoablation of the intercostal nerves (cryoanalgesia) for post-operative pain management.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of cryo nerve block to generate cryoanalgesia as post operative pain management
primary_outcome.description: Collect pain score to assess the effect of cryoanalgesia effect with a follow up duration of up to 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of cryo nerve block to generate cryoanalgesia as post operative pain management
primary_outcome.description: Collect adverse events occurred during and post operation to assess the safety of the cryo nerve block procedure.

intervention.intervention_name: AtriCure Cryo Nerve Block (cryoNB) Device Family
intervention.description: Use of Atricure Cryo Nerve Block Device Family to generate cryoanalgesia for the management of post operative pain.

study_pop.textblock: The REDUCE registry eligibility is open to sites and physicians performing cryo nerve block procedures as treatments for patients to generate croanalgesia as a post operative pain management method using the AtriCure Cryo Nerve Block (cryoNB) Device Family. Subjects must have been scheduled to undergo or have undergone the cryo nerve block procedure and must meet all eligibility criteria in order for their treatment and results to be considered for this registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient scheduled to undergo or have undergone cryo nerve block procedure as post operative pain management
- Patient >= 18 years of age
- Patient willing to provide written informed consent (defined as legally effective, documented confirmation of a subject's voluntary agreement to participate in this Registry) or authorization per institution and geographical requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is enrolled in a concurrent study that may interfere with the outcome of the registry
- Patient with exclusion criteria required by FDA or local governance
